snippet: Removing information from manuscripts describing experiments that made a lethal bird flu more likely to transmit among humans “maximized the benefits to society and minimized the risks,” the government’s biosecurity panel said.
abstract: Government's biosecurity panel says removing information from manuscripts describing experiments that made a lethal bird flu more likely to transmit among humans 'maximized the benefits to society and minimized the risks'.
lead_paragraph: Removing information from manuscripts describing experiments that made a lethal bird flu more likely to transmit among humans “maximized the benefits to society and minimized the risks,” the government’s biosecurity panel said.

headline.main: Panel Praises Removal of Details on Bird Flu
headline.print_headline: Panel Praises Removal of Details On Bird Flu

keywords.value: National Science Advisory Board for Biosecurity
